thread.title: Keeping up with the Kattarshians: Iceland's Big Brother for cats
thread.title_full: Keeping up with the Kattarshians: Iceland's Big Brother for cats

author: Emma Rosen
title: Keeping up with the Kattarshians: Iceland's Big Brother for cats
text:
Keeping up with the Kattarshians: Iceland's Big Brother for cats Briet having a lazy afternoon Credit: @Kattarshians/Facebook.com 16 February 2017 • 2:05pm 
A local Icelandic news website has started live streaming the exploits of 4 nine week old kittens. 
The show, Keeping Up with the Kattarshians, in run in partnership with a cat shelter, to promote the adoption of stray cats. 
The kittens were found, along with their mother, in a car park in Reykjavik. 
The Kattarshians features Guðni, Stubbur, Briet and Ronja, in a furry feline mix between Big Brother and Keeping Up with the Kardashians. — Bjarki (@BjarkiStBr) 9 February 2017 
T he set is a large dollhouse fitted out with cameras, so viewers can stream the highs and lows of kitten life at any time of day or night. 
There is no shortage of drama, as pack leader Stubbur discovered when he injured his tail and the end had to be amputated by a vet. 
Each of the young cats has a clear personality; Guðni is the most sociable, he enjoys playing with his siblings and eating a lot of food. Ronja is the sweetest in nature and Briet is a dreamer. Stubbur, of course, is in charge. — Árni Torfason (@arnitorfa) 9 February 2017 
S o far the show has been a success as the channel, Nutiminn , has reported that one of the kittens has already been adopted. 
Hopes are high for both the other three, along with the other cats in the nearby shelter. 
With 7.5 million pet cats in UK households, the show is sure to be paw-some. Live stream cameras 
Y ou can keep up with the cutest reality show in the world here . Follow Telegraph Entertainment
